BundledProductOffering.description: A type of ProductOffering that belongs to a grouping of ProductOfferings made available to the market. It inherits of all attributes of ProductOffering.

href.description: Unique reference of the BundledProductOffering

id.description: Unique identifier of the BundledProductOffering

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

name.description: Name of the BundledProductOffering

bundledProductOfferingOption.description: A set of numbers that specifies the lower and upper limits for a ProductOffering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering. Values can range from 0 to unbounded.

BundledProductOfferingOption.description: A set of numbers that specifies the lower and upper limits for a ProductOffering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering. Values can range from 0 to unbounded

numberRelOfferDefault.description: Default number of produc offereings that should be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering

numberRelOfferLowerLimit.description: lower limit for a product offering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering

numberRelOfferUpperLimit.description: upper limit for a product offering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering

BundledProductOfferingPriceRelationship.description: This represents a bundling pricing relationship, allowing a price to be composed of multiple other prices (e.g. a recurring charge and a onetime charge).

href.description: hyperlink reference of the bundled product offering price

id.description: Unique identifier of the bundled product offering price

name.description: Name of the bundled product offering price

BundledProductOfferingRef.description: BundledProductOffering Reference. A type of ProductOffering that belongs to a grouping of ProductOfferings made available to the market. It inherits of all attributes of ProductOffering.

BundledProductSpecification.description: A type of ProductSpecification that belongs to a grouping of ProductSpecifications made available to the market. It inherits of all attributes of ProductSpecification.

href.description: Reference of the product specification

id.description: Unique identifier of the product specification

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

name.description: Name of the product specification

description.description: A description of this interaction

id.description: The unique ID for this interaction

day.description: Day where the calendar status applies (e.g.: monday, mon-to-fri, weekdays, weekend, all week, ...)

status.description: Indication of the availability of the site (e.g.: open)

timeZone.description: Indication of the timezone applicable to the calendar information (e.g.: Paris, GMT+1)

CancelOrder.description: A Order cancel is a type of task which  can  be used to place a request to cancel an order

requestedCancellationDate.description: Date when the submitter wants the order to be cancelled

href.description: Hyperlink to access the cancellation request

id.description: id of the cancellation request (this is not an order id)

effectiveCancellationDate.description: Date when the order is cancelled.

cancellationReason.description: Reason why the order is cancelled.

state.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the cancellation request, such as Acknowledged, Rejected, InProgress, Pending and so on.

CancelProductOrder.description: Request for cancellation an existing product order

CancelReservation.description: A Cancel Reservation is a type of task which  can  be used to place a request to cancel a reservation

cancellationReason.description: Reason why the reservation is cancelled.

effectiveCancellationDate.description: Date when the reservation is cancelled.

requestedCancellationDate.description: Date when the submitter wants the reservation to be cancelled

CancelResourceOrder.description: Request for cancellation an existing resource order

CancelServiceOrder.description: Request for cancellation an existing Service order

Capacity.description: Specific ability of an entity measured in quantity and units of quantity over an extended period.

applicableTimePeriod.description: The period of time for which Capacity or CapacityDemand applies.

place.description:
Used to define a place useful for the resource. 
Used to indicate reserved resources.

plannedOrActualCapacity.description: An indicator that specifies whether the capacity is planned or actual.

capacityAmount.description: A value and units that define the CapacityAmount, such as 10000 ea, 10B Mb. Instance values are mutually exclusive with From and To capacityAmounts and range interval.

capacityAmountFrom.description: The low range value that a Capacity Amount can take on.

capacityAmountTo.description: The upper range value that CapacityAmount can take on.

rangeInterval.description:
An indicator that specifies the inclusion or exclusion of the capacityAmount From and capacityAmountTo attributes. 
Possible values are "open", "closed", "closedBottom" and "closedTop".

CartItem.description: An identified part of the shopping cart. A shopping cart  is decomposed into one or more shopping cart item. Cart item represents a product offering or bundled product offering that user wish to purchase, as well as the pricing of the product offering, reference to product in case of configured characteristic or installation address. Cart items can be related to other cart item to related bundled offerings or reference cart Items to a shipping options

action.description: The action to be carried out on the Product. Can be: add, modify, delete, noChange

id.description: Identifier of the cart item (generally it is a sequence number 01, 02, 03, ...) in the shopping cart

status.description: status of cart item. e.g "active" , "savedForLater".

CartItemActionType.description: action to be performed on the product

CartItemRef.description: CartIIem reference. A CartItem is an identified part of the shopping cart.

id.description: Unique identifier of the cart item

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

CartItemRelationship.description: Relationship among cart items mainly other than hierarchical relationships such as "relyOn", "dependentOn", "shipping" etc.

id.description: Unique identifier of the referred cart item

relationshipType.description: Type of the cart item relationship

CartItemStatusType.description: Possible values for the status of the cart item

CartPrice.description: An amount, usually of money, that represents the actual price paid by the customer for this item. May represent the total price of the shopping cart or the total of the cart item depending on the relation

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail the semantics of this order item price.

name.description: A short descriptive name such as "Subscription price".

priceType.description: A category that describes the price, such as recurring, discount, allowance, penalty, and so forth

productOfferingPrice.description: An amount, usually of money, that is asked for or allowed when a ProductOffering is bought, rented, or leased. The price is valid for a defined period of time.

Cash.description: A cash method of payment. It has no additional data, but it could be extended to add information e.g.: the cashier who took the payment, the person who paid, etc

CashDetails.description: Cash has no additional data, but it could be extended to add information (e.g.: the cashier who took the payment, the person who paid, etc)

description.description: Text describing the contents of the payment method

href.description: A resource URI pointing to the resource in the server that stores the detailed information. This is typically the resource url to retrieve individual details for the specific payment method

id.description: Unique Identifier within the server for the payment method.

name.description: Friendly name assigned to the payment method

preferred.description: If the method is the preferred one by the owner. Typically used when querying for the payment methods of a specific customer or account

validFor.description: Date interval in which the payment method is valid

Catalog.description: A collection of Product Offerings, intended for a specific DistributionChannel, enhanced with additional information such as SLA parameters, invoicing and shipping details

href.description: Unique reference of the catalog

id.description: Unique identifier of the Catalog

description.description: Description of this catalog

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

name.description: Name of the catalog

catalogType.description: Indicates if the catalog is a product, service or resource catalog

validFor.description: The period for which the catalog is valid

relatedParty.description: List of parties involved in this catalog

category.description: List of root categories contained in this catalog

Category.description: The category resource is used to group product offerings, service and resource candidates in logical containers. Categories can contain other categories and/or product offerings, resource or service candidates.

description.description: Description of the category

href.description: Reference of the category

id.description: Unique identifier of the category

isRoot.description: If true, this Boolean indicates that the category is a root of categories

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

name.description: Name of the category

parentId.description: Unique identifier of the parent category

productOffering.description: A product offering represents entities that are orderable from the provider of the catalog, this resource includes pricing information.

subCategory.description: The category resource is used to group product offerings, service and resource candidates in logical containers. Categories can contain other (sub-)categories and/or product offerings.

validFor.description: The period for which the category is valid

ChangeRequest.description:
Change Request is a type of request which can be used for the management and control of Change Management 
process between a customer and a service provider or between a service provider and a partner and vice versa.

actualEndTime.description: Date and time when the change implementation actually finished

actualStartTime.description: Date and time when the change implementation actually started

budget.description: The budget reserved for the change

channel.description: A channel represents the way the Change Request was created

completionDate.description: Date and time when the change request is confirmed to be completed

currency.description: The used currency related with cost

description.description: Description of the change request

externalId.description: ID given by the requestor to facilitate the relationship set up and subsequent searches

href.description: Hyperlink to access a change request

id.description: Identifier of a Change Request. It is created on repository side (a Change Management system)

impact.description: Indicates the impact of this change

plannedEndTime.description: Date and time when the change implementation is planned to be finished

plannedStartTime.description: Date and time when the change implementation is planned to be started

priority.description: Used by consumers to prioritize a change request in Change Management system

requestDate.description: Date and time when the change request is raised

requestType.description: Indicates the type of the change request

risk.description: The risk to implement this change request

riskValue.description: The additional cost if the risk will happen

scheduledDate.description: Date and time that the schedule is made

status.description: Status of the change request and its sub-state

attachment.description: The attachments of the communication message (when it is email type)

relatedParty.description: The parties involved in the change request

location.description: The place at which the change request occurred

ChangeRequestCharacteristic.description: Characteristics of the change request to instantiate or to modify

name.description: Name of the characteristic.

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

href.description: The reference link to the change request

id.description: The identifier of the change request

ChangeRequestSpecification.description: Defines a set of attributes related to Change Request.

description.description: Description of the specification

href.description: Hyperlink to access the specification.

id.description: Identifier of the specification.

name.description: Name of the specification.

Channel.description: The channel to which the resource reference to. e.g. channel for selling product offerings, channel for opening a trouble ticket etc..

href.description: Reference of the channel

id.description: Unique identifier of the channel

name.description: Name of the channel

ChannelRef.description: The channel to which the resource reference to. e.g. channel for selling product offerings, channel for opening a trouble ticket etc..

name.description: Name of the channel.

Characteristic.description: Describes a given characteristic of an object or entity through a name/value pair.

id.description: Unique identifier of the characteristic

name.description: Name of the characteristic

valueType.description: Data type of the value of the characteristic

CharacteristicRelationship.description: Another Characteristic that is related to the current Characteristic;

id.description: Unique identifier of the characteristic

relationshipType.description: The type of relationship

CharacteristicSpecification.description: This class defines a characteristic specification.

charSpecRelationship.description: An aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among Specification Characteristics.

characteristicValueSpecification.description: A CharacteristicValueSpecification object is used to define a set of attributes, each of which can be assigned to a corresponding set of attributes in a CharacteristicSpecification object. The values of the attributes in the CharacteristicValueSpecification object describe the values of the attributes that a corresponding Characteristic object can take on.

CharacteristicSpecificationBase.description: This class defines a characteristic specification.

name.description: A word, term, or phrase by which this characteristic specification is known and distinguished from other characteristic specifications.

id.description: Unique ID for the characteristic

description.description: A narrative that explains the CharacteristicSpecification.

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

configurable.description: If true, the Boolean indicates that the target Characteristic is configurable

validFor.description: The period of time for which a characteristic is applicable.

minCardinality.description: The minimum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where zero is the value for the minCardinality.

maxCardinality.description: The maximum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where five is the value for the maxCardinality.

isUnique.description: Specifies if the value of this characteristic is unique across all entities instantiated from the specification that uses this characteristc. For example, consider a ProductSpecification for a set-top box, with a CharacteristicSpecification cardID. Each set-top box must have a different value for cardID, so this isUnique attribute would be set to true for the characteristic.

regex.description: A rule or principle represented in regular expression used to derive the value of a characteristic value.

extensible.description: An indicator that specifies that the values for the characteristic can be extended by adding new values when instantiating a characteristic for a resource.

@valueSchemaLocation.description: This (optional) field provides a link to the schema describing the value type.

CharacteristicSpecificationRelationship.description: An aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among Characteristic specifications. The specification characteristic is embedded within the specification whose ID and href are in this entity, and identified by its ID.

relationshipType.description: Type of relationship such as aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency, exclusivity

name.description: Name of the target characteristic within the specification

characteristicSpecificationId.description: Unique identifier of the characteristic within the specification

parentSpecificationId.description: Unique identifier of the parent specification containing the target characteristic

parentSpecificationHref.description: Hyperlink reference to the parent specification containing the target characteristic

validFor.description: The period for which the object is valid

CharacteristicValueSpecification.description: specification of a value (number or text or an object) that can be assigned to a Characteristic.

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic value can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

isDefault.description: If true, the Boolean Indicates if the value is the default value for a characteristic

value.description: A discrete value that the characteristic can take on, or the actual value of the characteristic

unitOfMeasure.description: A length, surface, volume, dry measure, liquid measure, money, weight, time, and the like. In general, a determinate quantity or magnitude of the kind designated, taken as a standard of comparison for others of the same kind, in assigning to them numerical values, as 1 foot, 1 yard, 1 mile, 1 square foot.

validFor.description: The period of time for which a value is applicable.

valueFrom.description: The low range value that a characteristic can take on

valueTo.description: The upper range value that a characteristic can take on

rangeInterval.description: An indicator that specifies the inclusion or exclusion of the valueFrom and valueTo attributes. If applicable, possible values are "open", "closed", "closedBottom" and "closedTop".

regex.description: A regular expression constraint for given value

drawer.description: Person or entity writing the check.

payee.description: Person or entity the check is addressed to.

signedDate.description: Date when the check was signed.

bank.description: Bank performing the payment of the check.
Bank performing the payment of the check

date.description: Date when the check was signed

drawer.description: Person or entity writing the check

payee.description: Person or entity the check is addressed to

description.description: Text describing the contents of the payment method

href.description: A resource URI pointing to the resource in the server that stores the detailed information. This is typically the resource url to retrieve individual details for the specific payment method

id.description: Unique Identifier within the server for the payment method.

name.description: Friendly name assigned to the payment method

preferred.description: If the method is the preferred one by the owner. Typically used when querying for the payment methods of a specific customer or account

validFor.description: Date interval in which the payment method is valid

CheckProductStock.description: CheckProductStock is used to log and execute check about product stock availability

creationDate.description: Date when the CheckProductStock was created (whatever its status).

requestedCheckProductStockDate.description: Date when the requester wished to have a response for this product stock check query.

completedCheckProductStockDate.description: Date when the CheckProductStock was completed.

requestedAvailabilityDate.description: Date when the stock availability should be check.

id.description: Unique identifier of the CheckProductStock

href.description: Reference of the CheckProductStock

instantSyncCheck.description: An indicator which when the value is "true" means that requester expects to get result immediately in the response. If the indicator is true then the response code of 200 indicates the operation is successful otherwise a task is created with a response 201.

state.description: State of the CheckProductStock (acknowledged, inProgress, terminatedWithError, done)

provideAlternative.description: When the value is TRUE means that alternative proposal should be provided (from other product stock, different date or quantity)

checkProductStockItem.description: A list of check product stock  item

relatedParty.description: A list of related party references (RelatedParty [*]). A related party defines party or party role linked to this CheckProductStock

place.description: Used to define a geographical place where requester wants to check stock availability

CheckProductStockItem.description: CheckProductStockItem is used to log and execute query about one product (or configured product) stock availability

id.description: Unique identifier of the Check Product Stock item

availabilityResult.description: Result of the availability like available, notAvailable, alternate

state.description: State of the CheckProductStockItem (acknowledged, inProgress, terminatedWithError, done)

requestedQuantity.description: Requested quantity to be checked for this product

checkedProductStock.description: the product stock too be checked

provideAlternative.description: When the value is TRUE means that alternative proposal should be provided (from other product stock, different date or quantity)

alternate.description: A list of alternate availability - from other product stock , different date or quantity

CheckServiceQualification.description: CheckServiceQualification is used to perform a technical eligibility on service configuration(s). It allows to retrieve services that are technically available in the context of the interaction (place, party, service characteristics, ...).

serviceQualificationItem.description: A list of service qualification items.

provideAlternative.description: When the value is TRUE means that alternative solutions should be provided

provideUnavailabilityReason.description: When the value is TRUE means that unavailability reason are expected for non available service.

qualificationResult.description: Qualification result for this serviceQualification. It could be:  qualified (all qualification item are qualified), alternate (At least one item alternate and no item with  unqualified), unqualified (At least one item unqualified)

checkServiceQualificationDate.description: Date when the serviceQualification was submitted

CheckServiceQualificationItem.description: A ServiceQualificationItem relates to a specific service being checked in a qualification operation.

qualificationResult.description: Qualification result for serviceQualification item. It could be: - qualified (request service are available), - unqualified (requested not available and not alternate available), - alternate (requested not available but proposal available)

state.description: State of the serviceQualification item (acknowledged, inProgress, terminatedWithError, done)

qualificationRelationship.description: Structure used to describe relationship between serviceQualification item from the same serviceQualification.

eligibilityUnavailabilityReason.description: A list of eligibility unavailability reasons (EligibilityUnavailabilityReason [*]). Reason for eligibility result if the serviceQualification result is no (meaning the service is not available).

qualificationItemRelationship.description: A list of qualification item relationships used to describe relationship between serviceQualification item from the same serviceQualification.

terminationError.description: If qualificationItem has not been done properly this lists the error(s) that caused termination of the qualification.

alternateServiceProposal.description: Alternate service proposal is used when the requested service is not available with characteristic and date asked for. An alternate proposal could be a distinct service Spec close to requested one or same as requested but with a different availability date.

CheckShipmentQualification.description:
CheckShipmentQualification is used to validate the eligibility of specific 
shipments.

provideAlternative.description: When the value is TRUE means that alternative solutions should be provided

provideUnavailabilityReason.description: When the value is TRUE means that unavailability reason are expected for non available shipments.

qualificationResult.description: Qualification result for this shipmentQualification. It could be:  qualified (all qualification item are qualified), alternate (At least one item alternate and no item with  unqualified), unqualified (At least one item unqualified)

checkShipmentQualificationDate.description: Date when the shipmentQualification was submitted

CheckShipmentQualificationItem.description: A ShipmentQualificationItem relates to a specific shipment being checked in a qualification operation.

qualificationResult.description: Qualification result for shipmentQualification item. It could be: - qualified (requested shipment is valid), - unqualified (requested shipment not valid and not alternative available), - alternate (requested shipment not valid but alternate proposal available)

state.description: State of the qualification item (acknowledged, inProgress, terminatedWithError, done)

terminationError.description: If qualificationItem has not been done properly this lists the error(s) that caused termination of the qualification.

qualificationRelationship.description: Structure used to describe relationship between shipementQualification item from the same shipementQualification .

qualificationItemRelationship.description: A list of qualification item relationships used to describe relationship between shipmentQualification item from the same shipmentQualification.

eligibilityUnavailabilityReason.description: A list of eligibility unavailability reasons. Reason for eligibility result if the shipmentQualification result is no (meaning the shipment is not valid).

alternateShipmentProposal.description: Alternate shipment proposal is used when the requested shipment is not valid as specified in the request. An alternate proposal could be a distinct shipmentSpecification close to the requested one or the same specification as requested but with a different carrier or shipping options

CheckWorkQualification.description: CheckWorkQualification is used to validate specific units of work

checkWorkQualificationDate.description: Date when the workQualification was submitted

provideAlternative.description: When the value is TRUE means that alternative solutions should be provided

provideUnavailabilityReason.description: When the value is TRUE means that unavailability reason are expected for non available units of work.

qualificationResult.description: Qualification result for this workQualification. It could be:  qualified (all qualification item are qualified), alternate (At least one item alternate and no item with  unqualified), unqualified (At least one item unqualified)

CheckWorkQualificationItem.description: A WorkQualificationItem relates to a specific unit of work being checked in a qualification operation.

qualificationResult.description: Qualification result for workQualification item. It could be: - qualified (requested unit of work is valid), - unqualified (requested unit of work not valid and not alternative available), - alternate (requested unit of work not valid but alternate proposal available)

state.description: State of the qualification item (acknowledged, inProgress, terminatedWithError, done)

terminationError.description: If qualificationItem has not been done properly this lists the error(s) that caused termination of the qualification.

ClearAlarms.description: Task resource for clear alarms operation

id.description: The identifier of the task

href.description: A reference to the task

state.description: Current state of the operation task

alarmPattern.description: Alarm patterns to match target alarms. An alarm will match if all of the sttributes in any of the patterns compare equal to those attributes of the alarm.

CollectionType.description: This is enumeration for CollectionType state

Comment.description: Indicates the comments entered on the alarm.

userId.description: Indicates the user commenting the alarm.

systemId.description: Indicates the system identifier on which the client set the comment.

time.description: Indicates the time commenting the alarm

comment.description: Indicates the text of the comment.

CommentAlarms.description: Task resource for comment alarms operation

id.description: The identifier of the task

href.description: A reference to the task

state.description: Current state of the operation task

alarmPattern.description: Alarm patterns to match target alarms. An alarm will match if all of the sttributes in any of the patterns compare equal to those attributes of the alarm.

CommonComponents.title: CommonComponents
CommonComponents.description: Highly reusable schema fragments for use in TMForum Open-APIs

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

CommunicationMessage.description: Communication message means a notification approach in the format of a message which can be dispatched (sent) to the certain user by the system with the content which can be felt and understood by the recipient. The user can be either a final customer or a customer service agent. The message can reach the customer in different interaction channels, including: email, short message, mobile app notification (push).

content.description: The content of the communication message

description.description: Description for the whole object

href.description: Hypertext Reference of the Communication Message

id.description: Unique identifier of Communication Message

priority.description:
The priority of the communication message.
Small number means higher priority.

scheduledSendTime.description: The scheduled time for sending the communication message

sendTime.description: The time of sending communication message

sendTimeComplete.description: The time of completion of sending communication message

state.description: Status of communication message

subject.description: The title of the message, necessary for the email and mobile app push

tryTimes.description: How many times do you want to retry the delivery of this message?

messageType.description: The type of message, such as: SMS, Email, Mobile app push notification

attachment.description: Any attachment associated with this message

characteristic.description: Any additional characteristic(s) of this message

CommunicationRequestCharacteristic.description: The values of parameters which are used in the content if the content contains them.

name.description: Content parameter identifier

CompressionEnumType.description: Enumeration of supported compressions. All extensions allowed.

ConcreteEnvironmentMetaModel.description: A managed concrete environment resource metamodel resource

ConcreteEnvironmentMetaModelRef.description: A reference to a managed concrete environtment resource metamodel resource

name.description: Concrete resource name

ConcreteResourceMapping.description: Individual mapping from an abstract resource to a list of concrete resources

Configuration.title: Configuration
Configuration.description: An apparatus (hardware + software + firmware) intended to accomplish a particular task (sensing the environment, actuating, etc.).

Connection.description: An edge in a resource graph.

id.description: Unique identifier for graph edge.

name.description: Descriptive name for graph edge.

endpoint.description: Resource graph vertices connected by this edge.

ConnectionPointRef.description: Connection point reference. A connection point provides a service access point (SAP) for input and/or output of the resource function.

ConnectionPointSpecificationRef.description: Connection point specification reference. A connection point provides a service access point (SAP) for input and/or output of the resource function.

ConnectionSpecification.description: A specification for an edge in a resource graph.

id.description: Unique identifier for graph edge specification.

name.description: Descriptive name for graph edge specification.

endpointSpecification.description: Specifications for resource graph vertices connected by this edge.

Consequence.description: A threshold crossing or a threshold ceased to be crossing results in a Performance consequence.

description.description: A description of a Consequence

name.description: A word, term, or phrase by which a Consequence is known and distinguished from other measurements

ConstraintRef.description: Constraint reference. The Constraint resource represents a policy/rule applied to an entity or entity spec.

ConsumptionSummary.description: The consumption counters (called ConsumptionSummary in the SID model) detail for example the different kind of consumption done on the bucket.

consumptionPeriod.description: Consumption counter period between a start date time and an end date time. For prepaid bucket, the period of counters is between the start date of the bucket and the effective date of the usage consumption report generation. For postpaid bucket, the period of counters is between the last bill date and the effective date of the usage consumption report generation.

counterType.description: Type of the consumption counter. We can give for example a counter of the used value for a bucket (counterType=used for example) or the value of the consumption done out of the bucket(s) (counterType=outOfBucket for example)

level.description: Counter level. The counter can be given globally for the bucket or detailed by user or by network product for example in case of shared bucket

user.description: Reference of the user for which the consumption counter is detailed. If the level of the counter is global (i.e. concerning all the users), the list of them is not specified. It can be found through the users listed in the network products of the bucket sub-resource

value.description: Numeric value of the bucket counter in a given unit

valueName.description: Value of the counter in a formatted string used for display needs for example

Contact.description: An individual or an organization used as a contact point for a given account and accessed via some contact medium.

contactName.description: A displayable name for that contact

partyRoleType.description: Identifies what kind of party role type is linked to the contact (a account manager...)

validFor.description: Validity period of that contact

ContactMedium.description: Indicates the contact medium that could be used to contact the party.

preferred.description: If true, indicates that is the preferred contact medium

mediumType.description: Type of the contact medium, such as: email address, telephone number, postal address

validFor.description: The time period that the contact medium is valid for

characteristic.description: Any additional characteristic(s) of this contact medium

ContainedItemRef.description: Describes a specific item contained in a parent element

name.description: Name of the related entity.

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

entityHref.description: Hypertext Reference of the parent element.

entityId.description: Unique identifier of the parent element.

ItemId.description: Unique identifier of the considered item.

description.description: Content description.

CorrelatedAlarm.description: Indicates the alarms attached to this alarm as correlated alarms from a correlation point of view. An alarm can be correlated to one or more underlying alarms. There might be multiple levels of alarm correlation and an underlying alarm in one relation can be itself a parent alarm for other underlying alarms.

Credential.description: Credential is a class that allow to describe an authentification method.

id.description: an identifier for a credential/authentification method for this digital identity

state.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle state of this credential (like active, inactive, expired).

trustLevel.description: A level of assurance associated with this credential - this could be used to limit/allow specific permission based on this trust level.

contactMedium.description: List of contact medium associated with this credential/authentification method.

validFor.description: The period for which this digial identity is valid.

CreditProfile.description: Credit profile for the party (containing credit scoring, ...). By default only the current credit profile  is retrieved. It can be used as a list to give the party credit profiles history, the first one in the list will be the current one.

creditProfileDate.description: The date the profile was established

creditRiskRating.description: This is an integer whose value is used to rate the risk

creditScore.description: A measure of a person or organizations creditworthiness calculated on the basis of a combination of factors such as their income and credit history

validFor.description: The period for which the profile is valid

CrossedThresholdInformation.description: Identifies the details of the threshold that has been crossed.

direction.description: Indicates the threshold crossing direction: up or down.

granularity.description: Indicates the granularity at which the indicator is evaluated for threshold crossing

indicatorName.description: Indicates the name of indicator which crossed the threshold.

indicatorUnit.description: Indicates the unit of the measurement of the indicator corresponding to the threshold that has been crossed.

observedValue.description: Indicates the value of the indicator which crossed the threshold.

thresholdCrossingDescription.description: Indicates further information on the threshold crossing alarm.

href.description: Url used to reference the customer.

id.description: Unique identifier for Customers

name.description: A word, term, or phrase by which the Customer is known and distinguished from other Customers.

status.description: Used to track the lifecycle status of the customer.

statusReason.description: A string providing an explanation on the value of the status lifecycle. For instance if the status is Rejected, statusReason will provide the reason for rejection.

validFor.description: The time period that the Customer is valid for.

engagedParty.description: The party - an organization or an individual - that is engaged as a customer.

characteristic.description: Describes the characteristic of a customer.

href.description: Url used to reference the customer.

Customer360AccountVO.description: Generic Account structure used to define commonalities between sub concepts of PartyAccount and Financial Account.

creditLimit.description: The maximum amount of money that may be charged on an account

description.description: Detailed description of the party account

href.description: Unique reference of the account

id.description: Unique identifier of the account

lastModified.description: Date of last modification of the account

name.description: Name of the account

state.description: Contains the lifecycle state such as: Active, Closed, Suspended and so on.

accountType.description: A categorization of an account, such as individual, joint, and so forth, whose instances share some of the same characteristics. Note: for flexibility we use a String here but an implementation may use an enumeration with a limited list of valid values.

Customer360AgreementVO.description: An agreement represents a contract or arrangement, either written or verbal and sometimes enforceable by law, such as a service level agreement or a customer price agreement. An agreement involves a number of other business entities, such as products, services, and resources and/or their specifications.

agreementPeriod.description: The time period during which the Agreement is in effect.

completionDate.description: Date at which the agreement is completed

description.description: Narrative that explains the agreement and details about the it , such as why the agreement is taking place.

documentNumber.description: A reference number assigned to an Agreement that follows a prescribed numbering system.

href.description: Unique url identifying the agreement as a resource

id.description: Unique identifier for the agreement

initialDate.description: Date at which the agreement was initialized

name.description: A human-readable name for the agreement

statementOfIntent.description: An overview and goals of the Agreement

status.description: The current status of the agreement. Typical values are: in process, approved and rejected

agreementType.description: The type of the agreement. For example commercial

version.description: A string identifying the version of the agreement

Customer360AppointmentVO.description: An Appointment is an arrangement to do something or meet someone at a particular time, at a place (for face to face appointment) or in a contact medium (for phone appointment).

calendarEvent.description: A calendar event reference (CalendarEventRef). The appointment is associated with a calendar event (an happening at a point of time) associated to a calendar entry.

category.description: Business category : intervention for example or to be more precise after SalesIntervention, orderDeliveryIntervention,...

creationDate.description: Appointment creation date

description.description: Short free text describing the appointment

externalId.description: External reference known by the customer

href.description: Unique URI used to access to the appointment resource

id.description: Unique identifier of the appointment

lastUpdate.description: Date of last appointment update

validFor.description: A time period (TimePeriod). Appointment beginning date time and end date time.

Customer360CustomerBillVO.description: The customer bill. Can be a regular recurring bill or an extra bill on demand by the customer or the csp.

id.description: Explanation: Unique identifier of he bill

href.description: Bill unique reference

billDate.description: Bill date, external customer view (in consequence: different to the production date of the bill)

billNo.description: Bill reference known by the customer or the party and displayed on the bill. Could be different from the id

category.description: Category of the bill produced : normal, duplicate, interim, last, trial customer or credit note for example

lastUpdate.description: Date of bill last update

nextBillDate.description: ). Approximate date of  the next bill production given for information (only used/meaningful for on cycle / regular bills)

paymentDueDate.description: Date at which the amount due should have been paid

paymentMethod.description: paymentMethod here is recognized to be not really necessary in a STANDARD. It could be obtained by a GET request on the billing account. Conclusion: paymentMethod is marked to DEPRECIATED and will be removed in one of the next versions.

runType.description: onCycle (a bill can be created as a result of a cycle run) or offCycle (a bill can be created as a result of other events such as customer request or account close)

state.description: Status of the bill

name.description: A word, term, or phrase by which the Customer is known and distinguished from other Customers.

status.description: Used to track the lifecycle status of the customer.

statusReason.description: A string providing an explanation on the value of the status lifecycle. For instance if the status is Rejected, statusReason will provide the reason for rejection.

validFor.description: The time period that the Customer is valid for.

engagedParty.description: The party - an organization or an individual - that is engaged as a customer.

characteristic.description: Describes the characteristic of a customer.

id.description: Unique identifier of the interaction item

reason.description: Reason why this item is referred

creationDate.description: Date when the interaction item is created in the system

Customer360LoyaltyBalanceVO.description: A loyalty balance, containing a balance unit and value.

id.description: Unique identifier for the loyalty balance.

href.description: A reference to the loyalty members loyalty balance.

quantity.description: Unit and value of the balance.

loyaltyProgramMember.description: Reference to the loyaltyProgramMember to whom the loyaltyAccount belongs.

validFor.description: The validity period in which loyalty can be burned using the account.

Customer360ProductOrderVO.description: A Product Order is a type of order which  can  be used to place an order between a customer and a service provider or between a service provider and a partner and vice versa,

cancellationDate.description: Date when the order is cancelled. This is used when order is cancelled.

cancellationReason.description: Reason why the order is cancelled. This is used when order is cancelled.

category.description: Used to categorize the order from a business perspective that can be useful for the OM system (e.g. "enterprise", "residential", ...)

completionDate.description: Date when the order was completed

description.description: Description of the product order

expectedCompletionDate.description: Expected delivery date amended by the provider

externalId.description: ID given by the consumer and only understandable by him (to facilitate his searches afterwards)

href.description: Hyperlink to access the order

id.description: ID created on repository side (OM system)

notificationContact.description: Contact attached to the order to send back information regarding this order

orderDate.description: Date when the order was created

priority.description: A way that can be used by consumers to prioritize orders in OM system (from 0 to 4 : 0 is the highest priority, and 4 the lowest)

requestedCompletionDate.description: Requested delivery date from the requestor perspective

requestedStartDate.description: Order fulfillment start date wished by the requestor. This is used when, for any reason, requestor cannot allow seller to begin to operationally begin the fulfillment before a date.

state.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the product order, such as Acknowledged, Rejected, InProgress, Pending and so on.

Customer360ProductValueVO.description: A product offering procured by a customer or other interested party playing a party role. A product is realized as one or more service(s) and / or resource(s).

description.description: Is the description of the product. It could be copied from the description of the Product Offering.

href.description: Reference of the product

id.description: Unique identifier of the product

isBundle.description: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering.

isCustomerVisible.description: If true, the product is visible by the customer.

name.description: Name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the product offering

orderDate.description: Is the date when the product was ordered

productSerialNumber.description: Is the serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

startDate.description: Is the date from which the product starts

status.description: Is the lifecycle status of the product.

terminationDate.description: Is the date when the product was terminated

Customer360PromotionVO.description: Promotion Resource is used to provide the additional discount, voucher, bonus or gift to the customer who meets the pre-defined criteria. Using promotion, the enterprise is able to attract the users and encourage more consumption, especially continuous purchases.   Normally Promotion is not regarded as one type of product or product offering. It is often applied when the customer buys the product offerings with the price or amount surpassing the certain limit.

@baseType.description: The base type for use in polymorphic collections

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing a resource (for type extension).

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

description.description: Description of Promotion

href.description: Hyperlink to access the promotion.

id.description: Unique identifier of Promotion.

lastUpdate.description: Latest update date of Promotion

lifecycleStatus.description: Status of Promotion, including draft/Test/WaitForApproval/Release/Suspend/Retirement.

name.description: Name of Promotion.

type.description: Type of promotion.The basic type is Award/Discount/Reduction. More types can be extended in future.

validFor.description: The period for which the promotion is valid.

Customer360QuoteVO.description: Quote can be used to negotiate service and product acquisition or modification between a customer and a service provider. Quote contain list of quote items, a reference to customer (partyRole), a list of productOffering and attached prices and conditions.

category.description: Used to categorize the quote from a business perspective that can be useful for the CRM system (e.g. "enterprise", "residential", ...)

description.description: Description of the quote

effectiveQuoteCompletionDate.description: Date when the quote has been completed

expectedFulfillmentStartDate.description: this is the date wished by the requester to have the requested quote item delivered

expectedQuoteCompletionDate.description: This is expected date - from quote supplier - to be able to send back  a response for this quote

externalId.description: ID given by the consumer and only understandable by him (to facilitate his searches afterwards)

href.description: Hyperlink to access the quote

id.description: Unique identifier - attributed by quoting system

instantSyncQuote.description: An indicator which when the value is "true" means that requester expects to get quoting result immediately in the response. If the indicator is true then the response code of 200 indicates the operation is successful otherwise a task is created with a response 201.

quoteDate.description: Date and time when the quote was created

requestedQuoteCompletionDate.description: This is requested date - from quote requester - to get a complete response for this quote

state.description: State of the quote : described in the state-machine diagram

validFor.description: Quote validity period

version.description: Quote version - if the customer rejected the quote but  negotiations still open a new version of the quote is managed

Customer360ServiceProblemVO.description: The problem information for Middle B which is abstracted in the service layer from the issued event information by First B

affectedLocation.description: A list of the locations affected by the problem. At least one of affectedResource, affectedService or affectedLocation should be present.

affectedService.description: List of affected services. At least one of affectedResource, affectedService or affectedLocation should be present.

category.description: Classifier for the problem. Settable. For example, this is used for distinguish the category of problem originator in [role].[category] format. Example: serviceProvider.declarer, supplier.originated, system.originated

correlationId.description: Additional identifier coming from an external system

description.description: Free form text describing the Service Problem

extensionInfo.description: A generic list of any type of elements. Used for vendor Extensions or loose element encapsulation from other namespaces

href.description: Reference to the Service Problem

id.description: Identifier of the service problem

impactImportanceFactor.description: Impact Importance is characterized by an Impact Importance Factor: overall importance of the impact of all the affected services, e.g. 0 (zero impact) to 100 (worst impact). The Impact Importance is a calculated field which is set by the OSS determining the impact.

originatingSystem.description: Indicates where the problem was generated

priority.description: An indication varying from 1 (highest) to 10 (lowest) of how important it is for the service provider to correct the Service Problem.

problemEscalation.description: Indicates if this service problem has been escalated or not. Possible values are 0 to 10. A value of zero means no escalation. The meanings of values 1-10 are to be determined by the user of the interface, but they show increasing levels of escalation.

reason.description: Free text or optionally structured text. It can be Unknown.

relatedObject.description: List of objects associated to this problem

responsibleParty.description: Individual or organization responsible for handling this problem

relatedParty.description: List of parties or party roles playing a role within the service problem

rootCauseResource.description: Resource(s) that are associated to the underlying service problems that are the Root Cause of this one if any (used only if applicable).

status.description: The current status of the service problem. Possible values are Submitted, Rejected, Acknowledged, In Progress [Held, Pending], Resolved, Closed, and Cancelled.

statusChangeDate.description: Time the problem was last status changed

timeChanged.description: Time the problem was last changed

underlyingProblem.description: A list of underlying problems. Relevant only if this problem is derived from other problems.

Customer360TroubleTicketVO.description: A trouble ticket is a record of an issue that is created, tracked, and managed by a trouble ticket management system

channel.description: The channel that origin the trouble ticket

creationDate.description: The date on which the trouble ticket was created

description.description: Description of the trouble or issue

expectedResolutionDate.description: The expected resolution date determined by the trouble ticket system

externalId.description: Additional identifier coming from an external system

href.description: Hyperlink, a reference to the trouble ticket entity

id.description: Unique identifier of the trouble ticket

lastUpdate.description: The date and time that the trouble ticked was last updated

name.description: Name of the trouble ticket, typically a short description provided by the user that create the ticket

priority.description: The priority of the trouble ticket and how quickly the issue should be resolved. Example: Critical, High, Medium, Low. The value is set by the ticket management system considering the severity, ticket type etc...

requestedResolutionDate.description: The resolution date requested by the user

resolutionDate.description: The date and time the trouble ticket was resolved

severity.description:
The severity of the issue. Indicate the implication of the issue on the expected functionality e.g. of a system, application, service etc.. 
Severity values can be for example : Critical, Major, Minor

status.description: The current status of the trouble ticket

statusChange.description: The status change history that are associated to the ticket.Populated by the server

statusChangeDate.description: The date and time the status changed.

statusChangeReason.description: The reason for changing the status

ticketType.description: represent a business type of the trouble ticket e.g. incident, complain, request

Customer360UsageSpecificationVO.description: A detailed description of a usage event that are of interest to the business and can have charges applied to it. It is comprised of characteristics, which define all attributes known for a particular type of usage.

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail what the usage specification is

href.description: Reference of usage specification

id.description: Usage specification unique identifier

name.description: The name of the usage specification.

validFor.description: The period for which the usage specification is valid

customerStatusDate.description: Date when status was set or changed last time

dataCreationTimestamp.description: Time stamp for data creation (e.g. system dump creation, event generation)

runTimestamp.description: Time stamp for data upload run

validFromTimestamp.description: Time stamp for business validity of entity record

CustomerBill.description: The customer bill. Can be a regular recurring bill or an extra bill on demand by the customer or the csp.

id.description: Explanation: Unique identifier of he bill

href.description: Bill unique reference

appliedPayment.description: Applied payment is a payment associated with the bill. There may be a partial payment, then there should be several applied payments available. On the other hand, more than one bill could be payed by one payment. In general there is an n:m relation between payment and bill.

billDate.description: Bill date, external customer view (in consequence: different to the production date of the bill)

billNo.description: Bill reference known by the customer or the party and displayed on the bill. Could be different from the id

category.description: Category of the bill produced : normal, duplicate, interim, last, trial customer or credit note for example

lastUpdate.description: Date of bill last update

nextBillDate.description: ). Approximate date of  the next bill production given for information (only used/meaningful for on cycle / regular bills)

paymentDueDate.description: Date at which the amount due should have been paid

paymentMethod.description: paymentMethod here is recognized to be not really necessary in a STANDARD. It could be obtained by a GET request on the billing account. Conclusion: paymentMethod is marked to DEPRECIATED and will be removed in one of the next versions.

runType.description: onCycle (a bill can be created as a result of a cycle run) or offCycle (a bill can be created as a result of other events such as customer request or account close)

state.description: Status of the bill

CustomerBillOnDemand.description: This resource is used to manage the creation request of a customer bill in real-time (on demand).

id.description: Explanation: Unique identifier of the customer bill on demand request given by the server

href.description: Reference of the customer bill on demand request

name.description: Friendly name to identify the customer bill on demand request

state.description: State of the request to produce an off cycle bill: Possible values are: inProgress, rejected, done, terminatedWithError.

description.description: Additional data describing the customer bill on demand request

lastUpdate.description: The last date time when the customer bill on demand has been updated

CustomerBillOnDemandStateType.description: Recommended Enumeration Type (not formal forced in standard): Valid values for 'CustomerBillOnDemand': 'inProgress', 'rejected', 'done', 'terminatedWithError'

CustomerBillRunType.description: Recommended Enumeration Type (not formal forced in standard): Valid values for the runType of a bill. The bill could be produced in a regular bill cycle 'onCycle'. Otherwise the bill is produced on a request (e.g. customer request). This could be indicated by 'offCycle'

CustomerBillStateType.description: Recommended Enumeration Type (not formal forced in standard): Valid values for the lifecycle state of the bill: new = 'bill is ready to validate or to sent', validated = 'bill is checked (manual / automatic)', sent = 'bill is sent with the channel defined in the billingaccount', settled = 'bill is payed', partiallySettled = 'bill is partially payed', onHold = 'bill will not be in further processing until open issues connected to the bill are solved'

bodyWeightKg.description: the weight of people in kg

bodyHeightCm.description: the height of people in cm

weightHeightReadingDate.description: Date when test or reading was taken

bpReadingDate.description: Date when test or reading was taken

restingHeartRateBpm.description: Resting heart rate in beats per minute (BPM)

heartRateReadingDate.description: Date when test or reading was taken

bodyTempReadingDate.description: Date when test or reading was taken

bloodSugarReadingDate.description: Date when test or reading was taken

cholesterolReadingDate.description: Date when test or reading was taken

restingRespirationRateBpm.description: Number of breaths while resting in breaths per minute (BPM)

respirationReadingDate.description: Date when test or reading was taken

dataCreationTimestamp.description: Time stamp for data creation (e.g. system dump creation, event generation)

runTimestamp.description: Time stamp for data upload run

validFromTimestamp.description: Time stamp for business validity of entity record

uri.description: URI for using the data access API

firstUseDate.description: date the device was first used on the network

guranteeExpirationDate.description: the date the device guarantee expires

DeviceCommons.title: DeviceCommons
DeviceCommons.description: Common defintions to describe Device and Device Model scemas.

DeviceModel.title: GSMA / FIWARE - Device Model schema
DeviceModel.description: This entity captures the static properties of a Device.

DigitalIdentity.description: DigitalIdentity is a class that allow to describe a digital identity for an individual or a resource or a specific party role. One of these three MUST be provided. If an individual is provided, this identity will be for all her/his partyRole. To avoid confusion it is recommended in this case to not provide partyRoleIdentified.

creationDate.description: Date and time of the Digital Identity creation (timestamp)

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the Digital Identity last update (timestamp)

status.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status of this digital identity (unknown, active, suspended, archived).

nickname.description: Nickname associated to this digital identity (like Juanito17 or the QuebecMoose etc...).

validFor.description: The period for which this digial identity is valid.

credential.description: A list of credential/authentification method that are used for this digital identity.

contactMedium.description: List of contact medium associated with the digital identity.

attachment.description: List of attachment associated with this digital identity. Could be use to link a cute cat or moose picture to a digital identity for example.

relatedParty.description: Parties who have an interest in this digital identity (like the organization in charge of providing identity). This is NOT the party identified by this digital identity.

partyRoleIdentified.description: Related Parties who are identified by this digital identity.

individualIdentified.description: Individual identified by this digital identity. In this case the digitial identity is for all her/his role. It is recommended to not provide partyRoleIdentified if individualIdentified provided

resourceIdentified.description: Resource identified by this digital identity. It is recommended to no provided individualIdentified or partyRoleIdentified if resourceIdentified provided.

DigitalIdentityContactMedium.description: Indicates the contact medium that could be used to contact the party.

id.description: Identifier for this contact medium.

preferred.description: If true, indicates that is the preferred contact medium

contactType.description: Type of the contact medium to qualifiy it like pro email / personal email. This is not used to define the contact medium used.

validFor.description: The time period that the contact medium is valid for

DigitalWallet.description: A digital wallet method of payment.

service.description: Organization, platform or currency backing the wallet (e.g.: PayPal, Yandex, BitCoin).

walletUrl.description: URI pointing at the digital wallet (e.g.: //paypal.me/johndoe).

service.description: Organization, platform or currency backing the wallet (e.g.: PayPal, Yandex, BitCoin...)

walletUrl.description: URI pointing at the digital wallet (e.g.: https://paypal.me/johndoe)

description.description: Text describing the contents of the payment method

href.description: A resource URI pointing to the resource in the server that stores the detailed information. This is typically the resource url to retrieve individual details for the specific payment method

id.description: Unique Identifier within the server for the payment method.

name.description: Friendly name assigned to the payment method

preferred.description: If the method is the preferred one by the owner. Typically used when querying for the payment methods of a specific customer or account

validFor.description: Date interval in which the payment method is valid

DirectDebit.description: Direct Debit is a fully automated payment instrument which is generally used for recurrent payments. It allows a creditor to initiate the payment order. In doing so, it exempts the debtor from having to send a separate payment order at each due date

mandateId.description: Unique mandate reference. Further information can be found on EPC002-09

mandateCategory.description: The identification code of the Scheme

signatureDate.description: The date of signing of the (e)Mandate

mandateStatusDate.description: The date of the mandate status change

firstDebitDate.description: The first debit date. The debit date of the collection is the day when the payment of the Debtor is due to the Creditor

lastDebitDate.description: The last debit date. The debit date of the collection is the day when the payment of the Debtor is due to the Creditor

cancellationDate.description: The date on which the (e)Mandate has been cancelled by the Debtor or the Creditor.

accountNumber.description: The bank account number, this could refer to the iban or swift number.

accountNumberType.description: The type of account number (e.g.: IBAN, SWIFT, ...)

reference.description: A reference that the party can later use to identify the direct debit.

BIC.description: The Business Identifier Code/Swift code of the financial institution where the account is located.

owner.description: The owner of the bank account. This is also the account name.

bank.description: The display name of the bank.

Disability.description: Lack or inadequate strength or ability.

lifecycleState.description: The life cycle state of the document.

version.description: A particular form or variety of an artefact that is different from others or from the original. The form represents differences in properties that characterize an artefact, that are not enough to warrant creating a new artefact

DocumentAttachment.description: Attachment refers to extensions or additional parts that is or may be attached to something (agreements, contracts, appointments) to perform a particular function. They can be communication attachments, documents and other.

description.description: The description of the binary attachment

id.description: Identifier of the binary attachment

mimeType.description: mimeType of the Attachment, such as: application/pdf

name.description: Name of the binary attachment

size.description: The size of the document or attachment. If this component contains the embedded data then the size is the size of the embedded data; if it is a reference without the data then it is the size of the referenced document

sizeUnit.description: The unit of measure for the size

attachmentType.description: Identifies the sub-type of the instance of binary attachment

amount.description: Time interval (number of seconds, minutes, hours, etc.)

units.description: Unit of time (seconds, minutes, hours, etc.)

Edge.description: Edge is a directed edge connecting vertices in a directed Graph.

name.description: Name given to this REST resource

description.description: Description of this REST resource

graph.description: Graph which this Edge is contained in.

bidirectional.description: Indicates if this Edge is birectional (true) or unidirection originating from the first vertex (false).

vertex.description: Graph Vertices connected by this Edge.

EdgeRefOrValue.description: Edge is a directed edge connecting vertices in a directed Graph.

EdgeSpecification.description:
A directed Edge connects Vertices in a Graph.
An EdgeSpecification is a base class that represents a generic means for implementing a particular type of Edge. In essence, an EdgeSpecification defines the common attributes and relationships of a set of related Edges, while Edge defines a specific instance that is based on a particular EdgeSpecification.

name.description: Name given to this REST resource

description.description: Description of this REST resource

validFor.description: The period for which this REST resource is valid

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update of this REST resource

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status of the edge specification

relatedParty.description: A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

edgeSpecCharacteristic.description: A characteristic quality or distinctive feature of an EdgeSpecification.

EdgeSpecificationCharacteristic.description: This class defines the characteristic features of an edge specification. Every EdgeSpecification has a variety of important attributes, methods, constraints, and relationships, which distinguish an edge specification from other edge specifications.

edgeSpecCharRelationship.description: An aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among Specification Characteristics.

edgeSpecCharacteristicValue.description: A CharacteristicValueSpecification object is used to define a set of attributes, each of which can be assigned to a corresponding set of attributes in a EdgeSpecificationCharacteristic object. The values of the attributes in the CharacteristicValueSpecification object describe the values of the attributes that a corresponding EdgeSpecificationCharacteristic object can take on.

EdgeSpecificationCharacteristicRelations.description: An aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among EdgeSpecificationCharacteristics. The specification characteristic is embedded within the specification whose ID and href are in this entity, and identified by its ID.

relationshipType.description: Type of relationship such as aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency, exclusivity

name.description: Name of the target characteristic within the specification

characteristicSpecificationId.description: Unique identifier of the characteristic within the specification

edgeSpecificationId.description: Unique identifier of the edge specification containing the target characteristic

edgeSpecificationHref.description: Hyperlink reference to the edge specification containing the target characteristic

validFor.description: The period for which the object is valid

EdgeSpecificationRef.description:
A directed Edge connects Vertices in a Graph.
An EdgeSpecification is a base class that represents a generic means for implementing a particular type of Edge. In essence, an EdgeSpecification defines the common attributes and relationships of a set of related Edges, while Edge defines a specific instance that is based on a particular EdgeSpecification.

EntityCatalog.description:
The root entity for entity catalog management. An entity catalog can be defined as a collection of entity catalog items and arranging them in a particular manner based on the need.
In comparison to Product, Service and Resource catalogs, the entity catalog is intended for the purpose of providing any TMF data model entity to consumers via a catalog, with its specification and policy providing governance over its content. Even Entity catalog may have an overlap with Product, Service or Resource catalog, it does not replace them. It is primarily intended to address those entities which may not be addressed by any of Product, Service or Resource catalog.
An entity catalog comprises of a list of RootEntities made available through EntityCatalogItems. This API addresses only RootEntity extended items as EntitySpecification. An entity catalog typically includes name, description and time period that it is valid for.

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

name.description: Name of the catalog

validFor.description: The period for which the catalog is valid

relatedParty.description: The parties who are involved or have an interest in this catalog

category.description: The categories used in this catalog

EntityCatalogItem.description:
An EntityCatalogItem is an entity that allows any ProductOffering, ServiceCandidate, ResourceCandidate, or even any object inheriting from RootEntity, to be available to a catalog. The CatalogSpecification and Policy of the catalog governs the content of the EntityCatalogItem. This API addresses only EntitySpecification items extended from RootEntity as EntityCatalogItem.
The EntityCatalogItem resource (JSON format) represents a set of characteristics that define the values given by the EntityCatalogItem.

EntitySpecification.description:
EntitySpecification is a class that offers characteristics to describe a type of entity. Entities are generic constructs that may be used to describe bespoke business entities that are not effectively covered by the existing SID model.
Functionally, the entity specification acts as a template by which entities may be instantiated and described. By sharing the same specification, these entities would therefore share the same set of characteristics.
Note: The configurable attribute on the specCharacteristics determines if an entity instantiated from the entity specification can override the value of the attribute. When set to false, the entity instance may not define a value that differs from the value in the specification.

ExternalIdentifier.description: An identification of an entity that is owned by or originates in a software system different from the current system, for example a ProductOrder handed off from a commerce platform into an order handling system. The structure identifies the system itself, the nature of the entity within the system (e.g. class name) and the unique ID of the entity within the system. It is anticipated that multiple external IDs can be held for a single entity, e.g. if the entity passed through multiple systems on the way to the current system. In this case the consumer is expected to sequence the IDs in the array in reverse order of provenance, i.e. most recent system first in the list.

isCNF.description: This is a Boolean attribute that, if true, defines the condition clause of this rule to be represented in Conjunctive Normal Form (e.g., an AND of ORs). If the value of this attribute is false, then the condition clause will be represented in Disjunctive Normal Form (e.g., an OR of ANDs).

hasSubRules.description: A Boolean attribute that signifies whether this loyalty rule has one or more sub-rules. Sub-rules are used to enforce a hierarchical nesting of rules, so that parent rules may control the execution and other semantics of sub-rules that they contain.

isMandatoryEvaluation.description: A Boolean attribute that, if true, signifies that evaluation (and possibly action execution) of this entity is mandatory and must be attempted. If the Mandatory property value of this entity is false, then the evaluation of this entity is considered to be 'best effort' and may be ignored.

MeasureThresholdRuleViolation.description:
A measureThresholdRuleViolation is a violation of a rule that defines the in the 
MericDefMeasureThresholdRule.

conformanceComparatorLower.description:
An operator that when applied on a value specifies whether a 
threshold is crossed or ceased to be crossed. This operator is used to compare with the conformanceTargetLower if used.

conformanceComparatorUpper.description:
An operator that when applied on a value specifies whether a 
threshold is crossed or ceased to be crossed. This operator is used to compare with the conformanceTargetUpper if used.

conformanceTargetLower.description:
A value used to determine if the threshold is crossed or ceases 
to be crossed. It represents the lower limit. The value should be less than the conformanceTargetUpper if used. The conformance comparators should also be logically defined so as to not lead to a logically impossible condition.

conformanceTargetUpper.description:
A value used to determine if the threshold is crossed or ceases 
to be crossed. It represents the Upper limit. The value should be greater than the conformanceTargetLower if used. The conformance comparators should also be logically defined so as to not lead to a logically impossible condition.

description.description: Description for the MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule .

name.description: Name for the MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule .

numberOfAllowedCrossing.description:
The number of allowed crossing occurrences in reference to the 
tolerancePeriod without a consequence being initiated.

thresholdRuleSeverity.description:
A threshold can be generated in different severity levels. A 
crossing for each level may require a different condition and possibly trigger a different consequence.

conformanceTargetExact.description: To cater for values that are not numerical test metrics (e.g. a DSL line can be Synchronised or Unsynchronised. If the latter, the test should result in a rule violation).The allowed value can contain a REGEX expression.

tolerancePeriod.description:
An interval of time of allowed crossing occurrences before a 
consequence being initiated.

appliedConsequence.description: An Applied Consequence defines the action (prescribed action or notification) to take when a MeasureThresholdRuleViolation occurs.
